verbs.description: reheat (third-person singular simple present reheats, present participle reheating, simple past and past participle reheated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To heat something after it has cooled off, especially previously cooked food (also in figurative senses).
examples: I’m reheating some leftovers for dinner.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become hot again after having cooled off (also in figurative senses).
examples: He put the soup on the stove to reheat.
